Name: Art the Science Guy
Review Title: Received a melted mess of liquid gooey chocolate!
Review Content:
When you buy them in a local store you may pay more for them however, they will not be melted and mushy. Unfortunately, although the box I ordered from Amazon was well packed inside a larger carton with some airbags to secure it, due to the temperatures it had to travel in, they arrived soft and melted, I placed the box of chocolates in the freezer to harden them up and then threw out the ones that were a liquid leaking mess that covered the inside of the box and the other wrapped chocolates. I ended up throwing out about 20 of them as they leaked almost entirely out of their wrappers and then spent time wiping off the ones that were still more or less intact. As a result of the heat, the Truffle filling changed consistency due to the melting and hardening it no longer filled the chocolate ball and was not as soft as it usually is but it did have a similar taste.

I should have just returned them straight away or exchanged them for another box but realized that the same thing would happen if I reordered them and at first I didn't realize just how many were candies were nearly empty. So my advice, buy them when the outside temperatures are in the 70's or cooler and you'll get some tasty chocolates.

Name: Shawn Q
Review Title: Simply the best treats for your office!
Review Content:
These are always a favorite. I keep them on my desk for my co-workers to enjoy when they come and visit - and boy, do they! Nice, robust dark chocolate flavor and that soft center makes for a nice contrast with the hard shell on my palate. The only problem is restraining myself - although the fact that they're individually wrapped helps with that as there's no "oh, it's going to go bad, so I might as well finish it" pressure.

They also keep really well (if you need to store them). I've kept them (in a cool, dark place) for up to three months and had no change in the flavor. Cheaper chocolates can dry out and lose color - getting flaky or chalky - and, while I'm sure that would happen eventually with these, I've never had that happen.
